intro: Macleania sleumeriana, commonly known as the Sleumer's macleania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
